question_text: What is a likely result of connecting a 115V power supply to a 230V outlet without switching input settings?
answer_options: The system will throttle CPU power
The power supply may fail catastrophically
Nothing will happen until components are attached
correct_answer: The power supply may fail catastrophically
explanation: Manually switched PSUs must match input voltage. Feeding 230V into a 115V setting can destroy internal components immediately.
